@graph.caption: A square of ciabatta bread on a dark background

@graph.name: Ciabatta! - Vegan Richa
@graph.description: Light and airy ciabatta bread. A rustic Italian bread that's great for sandwiches, appetizers or sides. Nut free recipe with easy to follow instructions.

@graph.name: Ciabatta
@graph.description: Light and airy ciabatta bread. Use for sandwiches or appetizers
recipeIngredient: 1/3 cup warm milk ((nut or plant based))

recipeInstructions.text: For the sponge, heat the water to a warm 110 degrees.
recipeInstructions.name: For the sponge, heat the water to a warm 110 degrees.

recipeInstructions.text: Add yeast to it and let stand for 10 minutes or until frothy.
recipeInstructions.name: Add yeast to it and let stand for 10 minutes or until frothy.

recipeInstructions.text: Add bread flour and make a soft sticky dough. Keep this dough covered at room temperature for 12-15 hours.
recipeInstructions.name: Add bread flour and make a soft sticky dough. Keep this dough covered at room temperature for 12-15 hours.

recipeInstructions.text: For the bread, Warm the milk and add yeast to it.
recipeInstructions.name: For the bread, Warm the milk and add yeast to it.

recipeInstructions.text: Let stand for 10 minutes or until frothy.
recipeInstructions.name: Let stand for 10 minutes or until frothy.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the sponge, bread flour, salt and water and use a hand mixer to mix everything.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the sponge, bread flour, salt and water and use a hand mixer to mix everything.

recipeInstructions.text: Let this dough rise in a warm oven for about an hour. (keep a damp towel over the dough)
recipeInstructions.name: Let this dough rise in a warm oven for about an hour. (keep a damp towel over the dough)

recipeInstructions.text: Dough will be sticky and full of air bubbles. Turn dough out onto a well-floured work surface and cut in half.
recipeInstructions.name: Dough will be sticky and full of air bubbles. Turn dough out onto a well-floured work surface and cut in half.

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer each half to a parchment sheet and form into an irregular oval about 9 inches long. Dimple loaves with floured fingers and dust tops with flour.
recipeInstructions.name: Transfer each half to a parchment sheet and form into an irregular oval about 9 inches long. Dimple loaves with floured fingers and dust tops with flour.

recipeInstructions.text: Cover loaves with a damp kitchen towel. Let loaves rise at room temperature until almost doubled in bulk, 1 1/2 to 2 hours.
recipeInstructions.name: Cover loaves with a damp kitchen towel. Let loaves rise at room temperature until almost doubled in bulk, 1 1/2 to 2 hours.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake at 350 degrees F  for about 30 minutes or until golden.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake at 350 degrees F  for about 30 minutes or until golden.

recipeInstructions.text: In the first 10 minutes, spray water over the bread every 3 minutes, for a softer crust.
recipeInstructions.name: In the first 10 minutes, spray water over the bread every 3 minutes, for a softer crust.
